page.title: 12Whitleigh Community Centre
page.content: Whitleigh Estate was built between 1950 and 1959. Through the work of the Tenants' Action Group, and in particular, Mr. Eddy Thomas, money was raised to provide the Community Centre. Since 1977, there has been a Whitleigh Lottery to raise money. The Community Centre cost Â£20,000 originally and it was opened by the Mayor of Plymouth on 6th May 1980. A further extension costing Â£250,000 was opened in October 1983. Facilities provided include two large lounges, a bar, a main function area, skittle alley and games rooms. Games played include pool, snooker,table tennis,darts. There is also a place where residents can obtain meals. Colin Palmer
